meanings.definition: To take small bites or gentle bites
meanings.sent1: The rabbit nibbled on the carrot slowly.
meanings.sent2: She nibbled on the cookie during the movie.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel nibbled on the acorn with care.
meanings.sent4: Time nibbled away at the edges of the ancient ruins.
meanings.sent5: The mouse nibbled on the cheese, savoring each tiny bite.

meanings.definition: To eat or chew in small bites
meanings.sent1: He nibbled on the sandwich at lunchtime.
meanings.sent2: The hamster nibbled on the sunflower seed.
meanings.sent3: The child nibbled on the apple, pretending to be a bunny.
meanings.sent4: The waves nibbled at the eroding coastline.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar nibbled on the leaf, leaving a trail of nibbles behind.

meanings.sent1: The puppy nibbled on the toy, not wanting to destroy it.
meanings.sent2: She nibbled on her lip nervously during the test.
meanings.sent3: The kitten nibbled on the string, playing a gentle game.
meanings.sent4: The cold wind nibbled at their exposed skin.
meanings.sent5: The old book had been nibbled on by silverfish, leaving tiny bite marks.
